_exec_summary.SummaryText:
NORTH CENTRAL FARMERS ELEVATOR CO.
IPSWICH S.D. 57541

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES AT OUR FACILITY: THIS FACILTITY COMPLIES WITH NFPA - 58 REQUIREMENTS FOR LP GAS STORAGE , AND IT IS OUR POLICY TO ADHERE TO ALL APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL LAWS.  IF AN EMERGENCY WERE TO OCCUR IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY  THE IPSWICH FIRE DEPARTMENT AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND TO THE EMERGENCY.

A DESCRIPTION OF FACILITY AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED.  THIS FACILITY IS A RETAIL OUTLET. WE SELL PROPANE ON THE FARM  AND TO RETAIL CUSTOOMERS. THIS FACILITY CONSISTS OF ONE 21OOO GALLON TANK AND ONE 18000 GALLON TANK AND ASSOCIATED VALVES, PIPING, AND MISCELLANOUS EQUIPMENT.

THE WORST CASE SCENERIO AND ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENERIOS: OUR WORST CASE SCENERIO IS FAILURE OF ONE 21000 GALLON STORAGE TANK WHEN FILLED TO THE GREATEST AMOUNT ALLOWED ( 88 PER CENT AT 60 DEGREES), RESULT IN A VAPOR CLOUD EXPLOSION. THE RESULTING DISTANCE TO THE END POINT EXTENDS OFF SITE, AND PUBLIC RECEPTORS ARE WITHIN THE DISTANCE TO THE END POINT. OUR ALTERNATE SCENERIO IS CHECK VALVE LEADING TO A 10 MINUTE RELEASE AND EXPLOSION.  THE RESULTING DISTANCE TO THE END POINT EXTENDS OFF SITE, AND PUBLIC RECEPTORS ARE WITHIN THE DISTANCE TO THE END POINT.

THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL / SPECIFIC PREVENTIONS STEPS. THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENT PREVENTION RULE AND ALL APPLICABLE STATE AND LOCAL CODES AND REGULATIONS. THE PROPANE SYSTEM IS DESIGNED , INSTALLED, AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH NFPA- 58 AND STATE LAWS.

5 YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.  WE HAVE NEVER HAD A ACCIDENT INVOLVING PROPANE THAT CAUSED DEATH, INJURY, PROPERTY OR ENVIREMENTAL DAMAGE, EVACUATION, OR SHELTERINGS IN PLACE.

THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM .  IN THE EVENT OF A EMERGENCY INVOLVING OUR PROPANE SYSTEM, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE IPSWICH FIRE DEPARTMENT AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND TO THE EMERGENCY. WE HAVE DISCUSSED THIS POLICY WITH THE FIRE DE

PARTMENT , MEMBERS OF THE FIRE DEPARTMENT HAVE INSPECTED OUR PROPANE PLANT.

PLAN CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.  SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ONGOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE PERFORMED TO ACCESS THE MAINTANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  THERE ARE NO SPECIFIC PROPANE SAFETY RECCOMMNDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTIONS AT THIS TIME.
